issue.title: CollisionTest in physics.cc has incorrect analytical answer

content.raw: I think this [line](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/a676255484971eb823e037492a76fff1cfb66436/test/integration/physics.cc?at=default#cl-1372) was modified to allow some fuzz in the collision time. So I think it is (sort of) fixed. It really ought to have some comments saying what it is trying to do since it is obscure. I have some you can swipe if you want in the equivalent Simbody test [GazeboInelasticCollision](https://github.com/simbody/simbody/blob/master/Simbody/tests/GazeboInelasticCollision.cpp#L35). I used a different fix there, but I think the intro comments apply.
content.html: I think this line was modified to allow some fuzz in the collision time. So I think it is (sort of) fixed. It really ought to have some comments saying what it is trying to do since it is obscure. I have some you can swipe if you want in the equivalent Simbody test GazeboInelasticCollision. I used a different fix there, but I think the intro comments apply.
